sen.j: 水炊き（みずたき）は、主に福岡県で食される郷土料理で、鍋料理の一種。
sen.e: Mizutaki is a kind of a one-pot dish cooked at the table, a local dish mainly eaten in Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「水炊き」は用語集には英訳が定訳で載っていますが、以下本文中の表記はすべてmizutakiとしました。
sen.e: Mizutaki is a kind of a one-pot dish cooked at the table, a local dish mainly eaten in Fukuoka Prefecture.
Mizutaki is a kind of a one-pot dish cooked at the table, a local dish mainly eaten in Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在は日本全国で食されるため、地域性が出始めている。
sen.e: As it is eaten across Japan today, it is getting customized in each region.
As it is eaten across Japan today, it is getting customized in each region.
As it is eaten across Japan today, it is getting customized in each region.

sen.j: 料理法は似ているが、福岡県とその他地域での差異がかなりある料理である。
sen.e: Though the ways of cooking are similar, there is some difference between mizutaki in Fukuoka Prefecture and in other regions.
Although the ways of cooking are similar, there are some differences between mizutaki in Fukuoka Prefecture and that in other regions.
sen.cmt: there is some difference→there are some differences、in other regions→that in other regionsとしました。Though →Although
sen.e: Although the ways of cooking are similar, there are some differences between mizutaki in Fukuoka Prefecture and that in other regions.

sen.j: 皮や骨付き鶏肉（主にもも肉）のぶつ切りを用いる。
sen.e: Chicken skin and chunks of chicken on the bone (mainly dark meat) are used.
Chicken skin and chunks of chicken on the bone (mainly dark meat) are used.
Chicken skin and chunks of chicken on the bone (mainly dark meat) are used.

sen.j: 鶏肉や骨から出る旨味を生かすために、他の調味料を使わずに水から煮立たせるのが本来の調理法のため「水炊き」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Originally it is cooked from water without any seasoning in order to make the most of stock from chicken and bones, thus it is called "mizutaki (stewed from water)".
Originally it is cooked from water without any seasoning in order to make the most of stock from chicken and bones, thus it is called 'mizutaki' (stewed with water).
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、位置を移動from →with
sen.e: Originally it is cooked from water without any seasoning in order to make the most of stock from chicken and bones, thus it is called 'mizutaki' (stewed with water).

sen.j: ただ現在お店によっては、味を安定させるため最初から鶏がらのだし汁を用いたりしている場合がある。
sen.e: Nevertheless some restaurants use chicken stock from the beginning so that they can serve the same taste always.
Nevertheless some restaurants use chicken stock from the beginning so that they can always serve the same taste.
Nevertheless some restaurants use chicken stock from the beginning so that they can always serve mizutaki with the same taste.
sen.cmt: serve the same taste→serve mizutaki with the same taste

sen.j: また福岡県以外の地域では、追加の出汁として昆布を鍋底に敷いたものもある。
sen.e: In other regions than Fukuoka Prefecture, konbu (a kind of kelp used for Japanese soup stock) is laid in the bottom of pot as an additional stock.
In regions other than Fukuoka Prefecture, konbu (a kind of kelp used for Japanese soup stock) is laid in the bottom of pot as an additional stock.
sen.cmt: other regions than Fukuoka Prefecture→regions other than Fukuoka Prefectureとしました。
sen.e: In regions other than Fukuoka Prefecture, konbu (a kind of kelp used for Japanese soup stock) is laid in the bottom of pot as an additional stock.

sen.j: 左記以外煮汁に味を付けることは基本的にはしない。
sen.e: Basically the soup is not seasoned other than the above.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・「左記」は「above」と訳し変えました。
sen.e: Basically the soup is not seasoned other than the above.
Basically the soup is not seasoned other than the above.

sen.j: 小皿にポン酢や柚子胡椒等を入れて味を付けて食べるもの（唐辛子のみ、または追加調味料として辛味をつけることはある）である。
sen.e: It is usually seasoned in the small plate with ponzu soy sauce (soy source containing citrus juice) or yuzu kosho (a spicy, hot Japanese condiment made from yuzu rind, chili and salt) (sometimes spiced with hot peppers or added spices).

It is usually seasoned in the small plate with ponzu soy sauce (soy source containing citrus juice) or yuzu kosho (a spicy, hot Japanese condiment made from yuzu rind, chili and salt), etc. (sometimes spiced with hot peppers only or other spices).
sen.cmt: , etc.追加、hot peppers→hot peppers onlyとしました。Added→other
sen.e: Cooked ingredients are seasoned with ponzu soy sauce (soy source containing citrus juice) or yuzu kosho (a spicy, hot Japanese condiment made from yuzu rinds, chili and salt), etc. that are prepared in small plates (sometimes spiced with hot peppers or other spices) before eaten.

sen.j: 普通、鶏肉の他に白菜ないしキャベツ、長葱を入れ、好みでキノコ類、しらたき、春菊などを入れる。
sen.e: In addition to chicken, Napa cabbage or cabbage and Japanese leeks are cooked together, and mushrooms, shirataki (white stringy food made from konjac starch) and garland chrysanthemum are added if you like.

In addition to chicken, Napa cabbage or cabbage and Japanese leeks are usually cooked together, and mushrooms, shirataki (white stringy food made from konjac starch) and garland chrysanthemum are added if you like.
sen.cmt: 「普通」を訳出するためusuallyを追加
sen.e: Usually, Chinese cabbage or cabbage and Japanese leeks are usually cooked together with chicken, and mushrooms, shirataki (white stringy food made from konjac starch) and garland chrysanthemum are added if desired.

sen.j: また鶏肉以外に牛肉や豚肉を単独で、あるいは豆腐や海鮮類（牡蠣や鱈）などを一緒に煮炊きする場合も水炊きと呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: Other than chicken, a dish made with beef or pork alone or together with tofu (bean curd) and seafood (oysters or tara (Gadidae)) is also called mizutaki sometimes.
Other than chicken, a dish made with beef or pork alone or together with tofu (bean curd) and seafood (oysters or codfish) is also called mizutaki sometimes.
Other than chicken, a dish made with beef or pork alone or together with tofu (bean curd) and seafood (oysters or codfish) is also called mizutaki sometimes.

sen.j: 残っただし汁にうどんを入れたり、飯を入れて雑炊にする場合もある。
sen.e: In some cases udon is added in the left soup or rice is added to make a porridge.
sen.cmt: 定訳では「porridge of rice and vegetable」ですが、文脈から判断してporridgeのみ残しました。
sen.e: In some cases udon is added in the left soup or rice is added to make rice porridge.
In some cases Japansese udon noodles are added in the leftover soup or rice is added to make rice porridge.

sen.j: 博多の郷土料理が起源とされることが多いが、鶏の鍋焼きは江戸時代から全国的にあり、明治以降になって鳥鍋として盛んに行われるようになった。
sen.e: Although mizutaki is often said to have its origin in a local dish of Hakata, hot pot of chicken had existed nationwide from Edo era, and became popular as chicken pot (fowl cooked in a flat pan) from Meiji era.

Although mizutaki is often said to have its origin in a local dish of Hakata, hot pot of chicken had existed nationwide from the Edo period, and became popular as chicken pot (fowl cooked in a flat pan) from the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: from Edo era→from the Edo period、 from Meiji era→from the Meiji periodに修正
sen.e: Although mizutaki is often said to have its origin in a local dish of Hakata, hot pot of chicken had existed nationwide from the Edo period, and became popular as chicken pot (fowl cooked in a flat pan) from the Meiji period.

sen.j: また、長崎に生まれた林田平三郎が1897年、15歳で香港に渡り、英国人の家庭に住み込みで料理の勉強をしていた。
sen.e: In another story, Heizaburo HAYASHIDA who was born in Nagasaki went to Hong Kong when he was fifteen and lived with an English family and learned cooking.
In another story, Heizaburo HAYASHIDA who was born in Nagasaki went to Hong Kong in 1897 when he was fifteen and lived with an English family and learned cooking.
sen.cmt: 「1897年」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: In another story, Heizaburo HAYASHIDA who was born in Nagasaki went to Hong Kong in 1897 when he was fifteen and lived with an English family and learned cooking.

sen.j: そして帰国後、そこで習得した西洋料理のコンソメと中国風鶏のスープをアレンジし、1905年に博多水炊きを完成させたのが起源であるという説もある。
sen.e: After he came back to Japan, he is said to have arranged Western consomme and Chinese chicken soup that he had learned to make the original Hakata mizutaki in 1905.
After he came back to Japan, he is said to have arranged Western consomme and Chinese chicken soup that he had learned there to make the original Hakata mizutaki in 1905.
sen.cmt: he had learned→he had learned thereとしました。
sen.e: After he came back to Japan, he is said to have arranged Western consomme and Chinese chicken soup that he had learned there to make the original Hakata mizutaki in 1905.

sen.j: がめ煮とともに、農山漁村の郷土料理百選に福岡県の郷土料理として選ばれている。
sen.e: Along with gameni dish, mizutaki is selected as a local dish of Fukuoka Prefecture in the hundred best local dishes of rural areas.
Along with gameni dish, mizutaki is selected as a local dish of Fukuoka Prefecture in the hundred best local dishes of rural areas.
